ngiemboon: Afùɔ láʼa Alád gẅie à laa nyìŋ Kánàhan ńnéŋe ntsíŋ ngwòŋ, à la júʼ ngie pa Ésàlayɛ ne fóo na mánzsè gẅie à kẅɛɛ Atalia ńtóo, ńgwóon ńgʉa ḿmaʼa wɔ́b lé ncù, tà ńdɔg tsɔ́ ntáʼ na pa Ésàlayɛ ńgÿo megàŋatsǎŋ ncù.
en: When the Canaanite king of Arad,   who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming on the Atharim road, he fought against Israel and captured some prisoners.

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ leen ńké ńkaʼa mmó mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńnéŋe yɔɔn láʼ na lɔ̌ɔn pwó yég, mbà peg ge pú pyág metÿǒsoŋ mɔ́b pɔ́ ntsèm.»
en: Then Israel made a vow to the Lord, “If you will hand this people over to us, we will completely destroy their cities.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zẅíŋe mmó gie pa Ésàlayɛ kǎʼ, ńnéŋ pʉ̀a Kánàhan na mbwó mɔ́b. Pa Ésàlayɛ pú ńzẅéte wɔ́b, ḿbyág metÿǒsoŋ mɔ́b, ńtsẅi lezíŋ yɛ̌ pàga láʼ lê Hɔɔma, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Pyága.
en: The Lord listened to Israel’s request and handed the Canaanites over to them, and Israel completely destroyed them and their cities. So they named the place Hormah.  ,# 21:3 Nm 14:45; Dt 1:44; Jdg 1:17

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ fó lekwɛ́ Hɔ̂ɔ ńgʉa, ḿpfó nzsè gie e lɔgɔ ye máŋʉ́ mekèkàʼa, lélɔg ńkéle ngwòŋ Éndɔ̀m. Táʼ, aláʼ gʉa tà ńkúu mánzsè, mbwó mɔ́b pÿɛ́.
en: Then they set out from Mount Hor by way of the Red Sea to bypass the land of Edom, but the people became impatient because of the journey.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a zye léshwóŋo té poŋ na Ssé mbɔɔ na Mǒonsê, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ pi ka gÿo peg fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńgʉa? Á kaa légÿo peg tóo nkùɔmekwaʼá ńkwéte keen? Ammó mpfɛ̌ té jʉʼɔɔn wɔ́, ntse nú ké te wó wɔ́. Peg kéen ḿpfɛ́ɛ mánà pfɛ̌ tà á pÿága wég, ée shúm léjÿó megàŋngɔ́ʼ.»
en: The people spoke against God and Moses: “Why have you led us up from Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread or water, and we detest this wretched food! ”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńké ńtúm mennú mie é gẅiin sìsìŋ é tsɔ́gte wɔ́b, ńgÿo pa Ésàlayɛ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn kwéte.
en: Then the Lord sent poisonous   snakes among the people, and they bit them so that many Israelites died.  # 21:6 1Co 10:9

ngiemboon: Aláʼ tó ńgyá Mǒonsê ńgɔɔn ngie: «Peg ka fʉa nò: peg ka shwoŋté na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ na gù. Shúshu, sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a légwɔ́ gie à ge jwoŋ mɔɔn mennú nzèm peg. Mǒonsê leen ńké sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a na twó pa Ésàlayɛ.»
en: The people then came to Moses and said, “We have sinned by speaking against the Lord and against you. Intercede with the Lord so that he will take the snakes away from us.” And Moses interceded for the people.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńcwoŋte nnú, ńkime ndùm tàʼa tÿǒ, ńzsé ngie nnú lɔɔn ńtsɔ́gɔ nyìŋ tà á pʉʼʉ twó yé ńdíe yɔɔn nnú, mbà à ge tsẅɛ́.»
en: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Make a snake image and mount it on a pole. When anyone who is bitten looks at it, he will recover.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê leen ńké ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńcwoŋte nnú, ńkime ndùm tàʼa tÿǒ, á zye fʉʼó, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie nnú tsɔgɔ́ yé, tà á líe nnú gie mé ka lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte, á cʉ́ʼ ńtsẅɛ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: So Moses made a bronze snake and mounted it on a pole. Whenever someone was bitten, and he looked at the bronze snake, he recovered.

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ cʉ́me mánzsè, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Obɔd, ńzẅɛte wó.
en: The Israelites set out and camped at Oboth.

ngiemboon: Éfó Obɔd, ńgʉa tà ńzẅɛte Ye-Abalim, á nkùɔmekwaʼá gie ée shÿó sǎʼnèm we ngwoŋó ye Mowab.
en: They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim in the wilderness that borders Moab on the east.

ngiemboon: Éfó wó, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Zelɛd, ńzẅɛte wó.
en: From there they went and camped at Zered Valley.

ngiemboon: Éfó ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Zelɛd, ńgʉa tà ńzyɛ́ʼ ntse Alenoŋ gẅie lesaʼá sé é fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ, ńzyɛ́ʼɛ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼ gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nkùɔmekwaʼá, ńtí nue ntse Alenoŋ ée lepàa ngwòŋ Mowab pɔ́ ngwòŋ Amɔɔ.
en: They set out from there and camped on the other side of the Arnon River, in the wilderness that extends from the Amorite border, because the Arnon was the Moabite border between Moab and the Amorites.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, atsɔ́ zɔ̀b tsɛ̀ɛ «Ŋwàʼne ncù Cʉ̀apʉ̀a» gɔɔn nò na tÿǒsoŋo Valɛb pâ metàʼ ntse mé mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa Sufa. Ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn nò na metàʼ ntse Alenoŋ
en: Therefore it is stated in the Book of the Lord’s Wars:

ngiemboon: pâ mefúʼ mie é gwaa gwɔ́ lepàa ngwòŋ Mowab, ńgʉa gʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Âa.
en: even the slopes of the ravines

ngiemboon: Akèm gie á pɔ́ɔnte gwɔ́ lélɔg ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉʼ gie lezíŋ ée lê ntse ntǔŋ, á jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kúu wó, ńtsẅi né Mǒonsê ngie: «Cúʼte láʼ, ńzsé ngie n nǎ ntse né pɔ́b.»
en: From there they went to Beer,   the well the Lord told Moses about, “Gather the people so I may give them water.”

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ leen ńké ńzɔbɔ zɔ̀bɔ ntse gie á gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Israel sang this song:

ngiemboon: Ntse gẅie mefùɔ ka tǔŋ, mbà mekěm la lɔg metÿǒ ntẅiʼ mɔ́b lâ mé lɔg sáʼa láʼ, lâ metÿǒ lefùɔ sɔ́b, ńdúʼte»
en: The princes dug the well;

ngiemboon: éfó Matana ńgʉa né Nahaliɛ, éfó Nahaliɛ ńgʉa né Mbamɔd,
en: from Mattanah to Nahaliel, from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

ngiemboon: éfó Mbamɔd ńzyɛ́ʼɛ tsɛ̀ɛ fùʼ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ Mowab, ńdíe shÿó twó lekwɛ́ Pisenga sie mé tyé wó ḿbú ńgyá nkùɔmekwaʼá ntsèm.
en: from Bamoth to the valley in the territory of Moab near the Pisgah highlands   that overlook the wasteland.  # 21:20 Or overlook Jeshimon,# 21:20 Nm 23:28

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ túm memántúm pɔ́ gʉa ńgɔɔn né Sihoŋ fùɔ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ ngie:
en: Israel sent messengers to say to King Sihon   of the Amorites,

ngiemboon: «Peg né ńtsɔ́ɔn lécʉa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ jú. Peg te gwáʼa mánzsè é giŋe tsɛ̀ɛ menkáʼ mie mé ka jʉ̌ʼ kà tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ wɔ́ɔ wɔ́; peg te ńnú ntse gẅie mé la túŋ wɔ́; peg ge ké giŋ pɔ́ ndùm máa lǎŋ tà láʼ pú zyɛ́ʼɛ láʼ jú ntsèm.»
en: “Let us travel through your land. We won’t go into the fields or vineyards. We won’t drink any well water. We will travel the King’s Highway until we have traveled through your territory.”

ngiemboon: Tá fùɔ Sihoŋ te kwoŋo lényé wɔ́b pɔ́ cʉa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ yé wɔ́, éfó ńcúʼte palÿɔ́ʼncù pé, ńtó tà ńkúu nkùɔmekwaʼá, á jʉʼ gie lezíŋ ée lê Yahásè, ńkem pa Ésàlayɛ lé ncù.
en: But Sihon would not let Israel travel through his territory. Instead, he gathered his whole army and went out to confront Israel in the wilderness. When he came to Jahaz,   he fought against Israel.

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ lÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b ńjÿó, ńkẅé láʼa yɔ́b gie ntse Alenoŋ pɔ́ ntse Yambɔg tÿɔ́ʼte, ntse Yambɔg gwɔ́ kwóŋ ngwòŋ, ntse Alenoŋ gwɔ́ ntsíŋ ngwòŋ, setsɔ́ lepàa gwɔ́ láʼa pʉ̀a Amoŋ á na shÿó sǎʼnèm, ńgwɔ́ lepàa sie mé la pwóon pwǒon.
en: Israel struck him with the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok,   but only up to the Ammonite border, because it was fortified.  # 21:24 LXX reads because the Ammonite border was Jazer

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pú ńkẅé metÿǒsoŋ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ, tà mbɔɔ ye Eshÿemboŋ, ńgÿo membʉ̀a láʼ mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe wó, ńdɔg ńgÿo sɔ́b leneŋé.
en: Israel took all the cities and lived in all these Amorite cities, including Heshbon and all its surrounding villages.

ngiemboon: Eshÿemboŋ laa sẅɛ́ɛláʼ Sihoŋ gẅie aa fùɔ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ tà fó fʉ̀ʼ gie à la lÿɔ́ʼɔ mvɔ̀gmvfò fùɔ pʉ̀a Mowab, éfó mbwó yé ḿbú ńkẅé láʼ yé gie á gʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Alenoŋ.
en: Heshbon was the city of King Sihon of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken control of all his land as far as the Arnon.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa píte la gɔɔn nò mǒ ngie:
en: Therefore the poets   say:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g la lu ssé ngwòŋ Eshÿemboŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Sihoŋ, alʉ́me mmɔ̌g kẅɛ
en: For fire came out of Heshbon,

ngiemboon: Mowab, ejù ngɔ́ʼ ké yɛ̂!
en: Woe to you, Moab!

ngiemboon: Táʼ, peg ka lɔg mekwoŋ kyɛ́d még, ńdʉŋ pʉ̀a Amɔɔ.
en: We threw them down;

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn lɔg ńgwɔ́ páʼ pa Ésàlayɛ la lɔgɔ láʼa pʉ̀a Amɔɔ ńgÿo sɔ́b leneŋé.
en: So Israel lived in the Amorites’ land.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la túm pamaʼa náŋ, pɔ́ gʉa ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ Yazɛ̂ɛ; pa Ésàlayɛ gíŋe ńjÿó mbɔɔ meláʼ mie ée mengʉ̀ŋe wó, ḿbiŋ fó wó, ńkẅile pʉ̀a Amɔɔ.
en: After Moses sent spies to Jazer, Israel captured its surrounding villages and drove out the Amorites who were there.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ piŋ ńkúbe nzsè, ḿbʉʉ na lǎŋ gie á gee né Mbashÿaŋ. Ɔg fùɔ pà Mbashÿaŋ lâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé metsèm gwóon ńtó, ńzáʼ pa Ésàlayɛ, á Endeyi lélÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b né ncù.
en: Then they turned and went up the road to Bashan, and King Og of Bashan   came out against them with his whole army to do battle at Edrei.  # 21:33 Dt 3:1,10; Jos 12:4; 13:12,31

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né Mǒonsê ngie: «Te pɔ́gɔ yé, n ge néŋe yé na mbwó mú, pâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé tà mbɔɔ láʼa yé ntsèm. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo na yé, páʼ ɔ̀ ka gÿo na Sihoŋ fùɔ pà Amɔɔ, á yé gẅie à kɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Eshÿemboŋ.»
en: But the Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have handed him over to you along with his whole army and his land. Do to him as you did to King Sihon of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.”

ngiemboon: Pa Ésàlayɛ zẅé Ɔg lâ penkʉ́ pé, lâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé metsèm té nyé mbɔɔ tàʼ nyìŋ, ḿbú ńjÿó láʼ yé.
en: So they struck him, his sons, and his whole army until no one was left,   and they took possession of his land.  # 21:35 Ps 135:10–11
